intro: Eremophea aggregata, commonly known as the clustered eremophea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters along the stems. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Eremophea aggregata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
